info.title: AI Stats Gateway API
info.description: Programmatic access to the AI Stats AI Gateway. All endpoints forward requests to the best available provider for the specified model, and return normalised responses with clear structured metadata.

tags.name: Chat
tags.description: Guidance around the conversational gateway flows.

tags.name: Models
tags.description: Listings of models and available providers.

post.description: Routes a chat completion request to the healthiest configured provider for the requested model. The gateway normalises upstream responses and adds auditing metadata to the payload.

schema.description: Server-Sent Events stream of JSON frames when the request is made with `stream: true`.

post.description: Evaluates text input against provider moderation policies and returns the gateway-normalised safety scores.
Creates one or more images from a text prompt using the configured provider for the requested model.
Creates an async video generation job or direct asset depending on the upstream provider. The payload is returned verbatim with gateway metadata attached.

200.description: Video generation accepted by the upstream provider.

get.description: Fetches the stored audit record for a given `request_id` that belongs to your team.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The `request_id` returned by a previous gateway response.

get.description: Returns the most recent latency, success rate, and breaker status for each configured provider.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Filter to a specific provider name.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Optional model id used to resolve candidate providers.

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: Endpoint identifier paired with `model` when deriving providers.

get.description: Returns a paginated catalogue of models with provider mappings, aliases, and endpoint support. Results are sorted by release date (falling back to announcement date) in descending order.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Filter results to models served by one or more provider identifiers.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of models to return (default 50).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of models to skip before starting the page.

parameters.name: organisation
parameters.description: Restrict results to models associated with one or more organisation identifiers.

parameters.name: include_endpoints
parameters.description: Only return models that support at least one of the specified gateway endpoints.

parameters.name: exclude_endpoints
parameters.description: Exclude models that support any of the specified gateway endpoints.

parameters.name: input_types
parameters.description: Only return models that advertise support for at least one of the requested input content types.

parameters.name: output_types
parameters.description: Only return models that advertise support for at least one of the requested output content types.

parameters.name: include_rumoured
parameters.description: Whether to include models marked as rumoured in the response (default true).

parameters.name: include_deprecated
parameters.description: Whether to include models marked as deprecated in the response (default true).

parameters.name: include_retired
parameters.description: Whether to include models marked as retired in the response (default true).

GatewayMetadata.description: Metadata added by the gateway to every successful response.

timing.description: Optional timing information captured during the request lifecycle.

GatewayUsage.description: Token accounting for the request where provided by the upstream model.

GatewayResponseEnvelope.description: Common fields present on all successful gateway responses.

meta.description: Include gateway metadata in the response.

usage.description: Include token usage details in the response.

finish_reason.description: Why the model stopped generating tokens.

reasoning.description: True when the choice contains provider reasoning traces.

allOf.description: Provider-native video generation payload. Fields vary by upstream integration and are passed through unchanged.

announcement_date.description: Earliest known public announcement date if different from release.

status.description: Lifecycle status of the model (Rumoured, Announced, Available, Deprecated, Retired).

aliases.description: Enabled aliases that resolve to this model.

endpoints.description: Gateway endpoints that currently route to this model.

providers.description: Provider mappings that can serve this model.

input_types.description: Input content types supported by the model itself.

output_types.description: Output content types supported by the model itself.

total.description: Total number of models matching the filter.

endpoint.description: Gateway endpoint served by this provider.

is_active_gateway.description: Whether the provider is currently routable via the gateway.

input_modalities.description: Input modalities supported by this provider-model pairing.

output_modalities.description: Output modalities supported by this provider-model pairing.

effective_from.description: Timestamp from which the pairing is effective.

effective_to.description: Timestamp when the pairing stops being effective.

ModerationInputContentItem.description: A single moderation content item: text or image_url.

ModerationRequestInput.description: Input to classify. A single text string or an array of rich content items.
